name: UPSC NDA & NA (National Defence Academy) Exam
description: A national-level examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) twice a year for admission to the Army, Navy, and Air Force wings of the National Defence Academy (NDA), and for the Indian Naval Academy Course (NA). It is a gateway for candidates looking to join the defence forces as officers after the 10+2 level.

eligibility.ageLimit: Unmarried male and female candidates aged between 16.5 to 19.5 years. For NDA (II) 2024, candidates must be born not earlier than January 2, 2006 and not later than January 1, 2009.
eligibility.educationalQualification: For Army Wing: Passed 12th Class or equivalent examination. For Air Force and Naval Wings of NDA and for the 10+2 Cadet Entry Scheme at the Indian Naval Academy: Passed 12th Class with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics.
eligibility.nationality: A Citizen of India, or a subject of Nepal/Bhutan, or a Tibetan refugee who came to India before January 1, 1962.
eligibility.numberOfAttempts: No limit on the number of attempts. Candidates can apply as long as they meet the age and educational eligibility criteria.

timeline.notificationDate: This exam is held twice a year. NDA (II) 2024 Notification: May 15, 2024.
timeline.examDate: NDA (I) is held in April/May. NDA (II) is held in September. NDA (II) 2024 Exam Date: September 1, 2024.
timeline.resultDate: Written exam results are declared within 1-2 months. Final results are declared after the SSB interviews for the batch are completed.

examPattern.mode: Offline (Pen and Paper based OMR sheets)

stages.name: Stage 1: Written Examination
stages.description: Consists of two papers. Paper-I: Mathematics (300 marks) and Paper-II: General Ability Test (GAT) (600 marks). Total marks for the written exam are 900.

stages.name: Stage 2: SSB Interview (Service Selection Board)
stages.description: A 5-day comprehensive personality and intelligence test conducted for candidates who clear the written exam. It includes psychological tests, group tasks (GTO), and a personal interview. This stage also carries 900 marks.

examPattern.markingScheme: For the written exam: In the Mathematics paper, each question carries 2.5 marks for a correct answer and a penalty of -0.83 for a wrong answer. In the GAT paper, each question carries 4 marks for a correct answer and a penalty of -1.33 for a wrong answer.

syllabus.name: Paper I: Mathematics
topics: Analytical Geometry of Two and Three Dimensions

syllabus.name: Paper II: General Ability Test (GAT)
topics: Part A - English: Grammar and usage, vocabulary, comprehension, and cohesion.
Part B - General Knowledge: Physics, Chemistry, General Science, History & Freedom Movement, Geography, and Current Events.

books.title: NCERT Textbooks for Physics, Chemistry, Maths
